author: Han Kang
notable_awards: Nobel Prize in Literature (2024); International Booker Prize (2016)
nobel_citation: for her intense poetic prose that confronts historical traumas and exposes the fragility of human life
key_themes: historical trauma; body & autonomy; silence & care; witness without spectacle; whiteness & absence; language as shelter
influences: Korean history (Gwangju, Jeju); lyric prose traditions; ethics of witnessing

author: László Krasznahorkai
notable_awards: Nobel Prize in Literature (2025); National Book Award for Translated Literature (2019)
nobel_citation: for his compelling and visionary oeuvre that, in the midst of apocalyptic terror, reaffirms the power of art
key_themes: apocalypse & collapse; grotesque & absurd; endurance; crowd & rumor; borderless drift; long sentence as immersion
influences: Central European modernism (Kafka, Bernhard); post-socialist transition; collaborations with Béla Tarr; East Asia travel
